content.detailedDescription: Driving to work at 930 pm on i-40 westbound coming into winston-salem , nc . was especially dark outside , moon was not out yet . something caught my attention in the sky . of course at first your mind sais , "airplane" .. but something was different , there were no typical flight lights , no particular direction , nothing attached to light , just a solid reddish orange object . there is a small airport in the city , so any aircraft would be very apparent on either approach or take off , this was not that . i immediately pulled off the interstate and pulled my phone out and recorded this object through my sunroof of my vehicle . the night sky was so dark and this object was so apparent , it was good for me seeing the object with my eyes , but bad for a recording because there was no contrasting objects . the object was very close and directly above , so much so that holding the phone directly straight up through my sunroof . i recorded the object for one minute and then it just disappeared right before my eyes . there wasn't a cloud in the sky , so i know it didn't move behind a cloud . i was astonished , it's so aggravating , who do you call ? what do you do ? who do you tell ? one vehicle pulled over behind me , but before i could go talk to them , they left . i sat on the side of the road and played back the recording and was disappointed that the recording wasn't as amazing as what my own eyes saw ; but , i was able to take individual snap shots of the video as it played on phone , every single frozen frame i saw something in the center of the object , like a dark center nucleus . i just don't know what to make of it ? your brain immediately tries to discount what you just saw , but i just couldn't find anything logical to blame what i saw on . wish i had a answer for what i saw , maybe one day ?!  .... i do have photo and video , but for some reason my phone won't let me attach to this site , please let me know a alternative email to send this to .. thank you..
content.summary: The orb appeared over i-40 , lasted about a minute , recorded it through my sunroof of car , two other cars pulled over on interstate to observe .

content.detailedDescription: My girlfriend and i was sitting on the back porch smoking a cigarette i was laying down looking at the stars and i moved my eyes towards the objects and jumped up and went to the yard when i first saw them they looked like they was saucer shaped and had a field around them that was glowing green and yellow mainly then they got closer and from 70 to 75 degrees they started changing shape from saucer like to cigar shaped and they looked to be about 1000 ft in elevation and when they got to 105 to 110 degrees they changed back to saucer shape but the body of object looked almost transparent the whole time we watched them i had my phone halfway out of my pocket to take a picture but it was like i couldn't take my eyes off of the object and we watched for a minute and a half to two mins and they disappeared over my neighbors house and path of movement had a slight turn but kept going the same speed and this happened aug 18 at 120 am and normally i wouldn't file a report on this but me and my friend and his girlfriend seen what looked to be the same two objects this morning aug 25 at 101 am please get in touch with me because i'd really like to find out what these things are!
content.summary: Saw it in the sky and jumped up watched it for a min or two changed from saucer to cigar shape the closer it got to us didn't make any noise

content.detailedDescription: Watching the shy, noticing all the airplanes having no con trails today.  after the fifth airplane, flying west to east, i see an object flying west to east but in an irregular pattern, it was fluttering like a butterfly.  then, it tales off gaining altitude, in a nne. direction and it disappeared very quickly. i was wondering if anyone else might have seen this?
content.summary: Silver object moving erratically then disappearing.

content.detailedDescription: I was with a friend star gazing on a saturday night at my lake house and witnessed very bright star like object moving e to w very quickly.  the object was at least 5x brighter than any other light in the sky.  my friend and i didn't say anything but were both watching it and he said to me "are you watching this".  i said "do you mean that very bright star like object moving e to w? yes of course i'm watching it". to which he responded "what do you think it is?".  keeping in mind i've been going to my summer lake house for 20 years and go star/meteor/northern lights watching for as long as i can remember - i said "i don't know, it's very bright and obviously moving very quickly so it's probably a low earth orbit satellite". then when the object was about 10degrees above the tree line it just stopped dead.  my friend who was with me said "i really don't feel comfortable at all right now what the f is that".  also keep in mind that i'm much more pragmatic about these sorts of things as it's probably the 10th or 11th time i've seen something very strange in the sky like that over the years.  and in 3 cases captured on camera while taking scenic or sunset pictures sometimes with multiple glowing objects moving in frame in successive pictures while they changed positions in the sky and in the camera frame. if mufon is interested in those pictures i can dig them up off my previous digital camera.  so anyway the object hovered/remained in place for about 3 mins and then dissappeared in the blink of an eye - not like winked out but just gone. needless to say my friend was freaked out as the first time he's seen something like that and we wet back inside the house and told my dad and other friend the story.  the lake i have a house on is right in the middle of the ottawa river valley so we get some pretty extreme weather and is a major fly over point for transcontinental and regional type flights from ottawa to toronto so i've seen probably close to 1000 different types of planes fly over in my summers there and also hundreds of satelites, shooting stars, so i definitely know that what i saw was none of those because of the dead stop hovering for multiple minutes after it was moving very fast overhead and then just disappearing like that.  the night was dead quiet and completely clear and can always hear planes ever if they are at 40,000 ft. any questions please contact me by email provided in this report.
content.summary: Was with a friend star gazing and witnessed very bright star like object moving e to w very quickly then it stopped and hovered for 3 mins and then dissappeared in the blink of an eye

content.detailedDescription: Just pulled into the parking lot of resorts world casino in jamaica queens, ny. my wife and i were sitting in the car in the parking space when i observed a single light in the sky brighter then venus which we saw during the drive there. i told my wife during the drive that venus is the brightest object after the moon in the night sky. we talked about it because the prior night she was telling our daughter it was the wishing star... so i was telling her what it actually was. so in the parking lot, i saw this bright light red/orange light to the west and knew it wasn't venus. due the closeness to jfk airport, i thought it may be a plane on approach. from our house on long island's south shore, we see this every night as the airliners approach from over the atlantic and then turn west towards jfk almost over our house. i didn't see any strobes or flashing lights that you see on any aircraft. about 45 seconds after seeing it, 2 more orbs appeared out of nowhere. we could see the distant tree line and the additional orbs did not come from behind the tree line. then about 15 seconds later 2 more appeared for a total of 5. they moved from about 25 degrees on the horizon to almost 45. then the lead orb abruptly turned right (north) at a right angle. it moved a little further very slowly, then stopped in a hover. the next 2 continued to move towards the first object then the last 2 moved closer. the original object never moved for the remaining 4 minutes or so, while the remaining 4 moved constantly, but very slowly. they all disappeared one by one with the original orb being the last one. the color did change from red/orange to orange/yellow as they got closer. the whole time we saw the objects, there were several aircraft that were observed both further away and closer and all of those aircraft we could see their strobes flashing. we never saw a strobe on any of the 5 orbs. i did get out and take 2 photos, zooming in as far as i can while resting the camera on the concrete base of a light pole. this was the second time in the last 14 months i have seen 5 orbs in the western sky. the first time was over farmingdale, ny about 2am 14 months ago. that time i shot 4 minutes of video with the same sony cybershot camera. i haven't figured out how to compress it yet to post the video. the pictures from last night are attached. i am a aircraft buff and have a strong knowledge of all types of aircraft, and i have no idea what it was that i saw but am 100% sure it was not an airplane or helicopter.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 5 orbs over queens, nyc

content.detailedDescription:
Seen 5  lights following each other in line, the last one was higher and closer to the one in front. going north then one by one turned to the east, dimmed and dissapeared. 1 minute latter a chopper whit his lights on came from the east and turned south (took about the same path) .
no sound was heard.
the sky was clear.

saw the same thing after a thunder storm 1 month earlier.
content.summary: 5 orange lights going north .

content.detailedDescription: Two light appeared over a building, one light slightly out in front of the other. this happened 6 more times, then the light broke formation and formed several  v formations, untill they slowly and gradually rose up into the sky and disapeared out of sight
content.summary: Small to medium lights eventually forming a v pattern

content.detailedDescription: My girlfriend and i were turning westbound on the bypass 4 129 on ramp when we promply saw 6 round glowing orange lights in what appeared to be two triangular shaped patterns moving together in a northeast heading. we were freaking out literally, and have seen the same thing in the same place once before, only it was a single light. time was approximately 10pm, and the patterns were moving against the wind, and completely silent. after about 3 minutes, the orange lights faded quickly very near to us as we jumped in the car to give chase, one remaining object was seen moving still in the same direction, but without the orange light, and possibly a reflected off white light. that was the last we saw of them that night. we have poor quality video and pictures. the ramp lights obscured the dark backdrop.
content.summary: My girlfriend and i were turning westbound on the bypass 4 129 on ramp when we promply saw 6 round glowing orange lights in what appeared to be two triangular shaped patterns moving together in a northeast heading.

content.detailedDescription: We were coming home late last night around 11.Pm - husband saw a glow in the sky - it looked odd to him.  since we were travelling in a vehicle - he immediately pulled off to the side of the road.  we both looked up through the front windscreen and saw an object - orange - pinky glowing orb - disc shape hovering motionless - then it started to move towards the north - quickly - we both got out of the vehicle and observed the object - we could see a black like outline around the glow which looked like the center - as it suddenly move upward really quickly it appeared to change its shape from disc orb round to what appeared to be a triangle.  at that point the black outline became more defined.  we saw it under the cloud ceiling and as it came overhead it went straight up and the shape seemed to appear more defined.  it had gone from a stationary object to a moving object then it went straight up and disappeared.  we didn't feel anything other than trying to understand what it was we had seen.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Massive large glowing pinky orange bright orb type - with a black solid outline against the clouds was stationary hovering then followed a path and went straight up into the sky

content.detailedDescription: At 9:25 pm, i noticed a single reddish-orange orb appear in the ne sky, near cassiopeia.  the orb appeared to be very far away in the sky; it had fuzzy edges, almost fluorescent orange and very unlike any other color in the sky.  it was probably 10 times brighter than any star.  it moved to the west.  a few seconds later a second orb, just like the first, appeared in the same spot where the first orb appeared.  then a third and a fourth.  the orbs moved single file to the west.  in the space between the little dipper and big dipper, the orbs appeared to stop moving.  then the first orb faded away in a matter of seconds.  the remaining three orbs then pivoted 90 degrees about the second orb.  the fourth orb faded, then the third orb faded, and finally the second orb faded away.  these orbs had a similar appearance to the four orbs that i reported on #49944.  another adult and a child also saw these orbs.  the child mentioned that the color of the 'things' was very unique.
content.summary: Four fuzzy reddish-orange orbs traveled single file

content.detailedDescription: Driving home after a night drive in the hills near where i live and while driving westerly along albany st we noticed an airplane traveling ne to sw directions .As we went around the curve we then saw a second object as shown in video and picture also traveling ne to sw, then we stopped the car and i recorded the event, which the ufo was tracvling in mutiple directions stopping and moving moving at an angle in various directions back and forth i took pictures and videos for about 60 seconds. at the end of the video, the object flew with grat speed descending toward a directions into east utica and below tree line
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Strange red and blue t or cross chapped objects with multiple lightts as seen in picture and video

content.detailedDescription: I was coming home from work at 9:25 pm, on august 23.2013 and upon pulling into my driveway, i noticed a bright orange light above the trees in the neighbouring yard to the right of my house. at first i thought it was a meteorite or something, but it was moving way to slow.  i stopped the vehicle, leaned forward to get a better look. the object appeared to be very low (400-500 feet ) off the ground. i got out of my truck and tried to figure out what i was looking at. this object did not have any sound coming from it, as it went overhead it was very bright. i would guess the size of the object to be around 100' wide. i grabbed my cell phone and took a couple of photos. the object was moving to the north west and never changed speed. as the object got further away, it did not appear as bright in orange colour. after a 1/4 mile or so, the object seemed to disappear. (could no longer see in the darkness)
content.summary: Noticed a single round object, glowing orange, moving slowly across the sky above my house going in a nw direction.

content.detailedDescription: I was watching tv. son came from outside to tell me to come see something weird in sky. went out to road so there were no obstructions. (we are in the country. dirt road, expansive dark sky, etc) stood and watched a bright, fuzzy edged roundish light moving from south to north across the sky. appeared to be faintly pulsating. deviated a couple times from straight line flight. moving to the left and right. slower moving than planes i've seen. did not hear any sound. kept watching until it seemed to pulsate or extinguish into nothing.
content.summary: Red/orange lightly pulsating bright light s to n flight path with a few l to r deviations. 3 minutes. seemed to vanish or extinguish into nothingness

content.detailedDescription: I reported 2 sightings a few days ago, since then, i see the objects every night, they are in different areas every night, i shared somephotos, and videos with you that i sent to dropbox.  do you know whats going on, i see them every night, please get back to me.
content.summary: I saw an orange red object for a couple minutes moving from the s/e to the west

content.detailedDescription: I had just got off work and was on the way home from a mariners game with my two friends. after we drop my friend off we take a turn down 240th and start going west down this hill towards the water and i notice 4 red pulsing lights. three are collected one above the other moving south slowly and at different speeds. one red light is by its self farther to the left. at the bottom of the hill we take a left on 16th and i notice that the red lights are starting to disperse. i begin thinking that by the time i get home i may not be able to see these lights because they're moving so quickly. before i know it two lights are tree level to the north and the lonely light is still to the west. we take a right and continue down the street for a while. when i look up to find the lights over our evergreen trees i see one flying above me (70 degree angle maybe). it was pretty shocking because i didn't think these lights were close enough to go from what seemed over the sound to above me head in seconds. we took a left and went down marine view drive and i saw one more red light behind us in the northern sky. the light wasn't as bright which made me think it was getting father. it's annoying because my camera wouldn't pick up the light but it was such a exhilarating moment. i've always wanted to say (i think) i've seen ufo's. it was so cool and interesting.
content.summary: Red lights over the puget sound

content.detailedDescription:
While at a campfire just north of willard oh, on north main st about 1200' south of townline road 12 , a bright red pulsating was noted by one of us rising from the horizon to the e-se.  six adults were present and witnessed the event, which was initially not used because of the bright red-to-orange pulsating light. . as the object rose, it appeared to be rising to the west, pulsating from red to orange in color. while rising, it appeared to be unsteady, but continuous in speed. once the object reached approx 25 degrees above the horizon, it began to slowly fade away as if moving away from us. the pulsating continued until it was no longer visible, approx 90 degrees. as it rose, the direction of travel appeared to shift to the north west. approximately 2 minutes later, another object did almost exactly the same thing as the first. same colors pulsating, same direction of travel, same origin on the horizon. approx 2 minutes after the second orb, the third appeared. this one seemed to originate a little bit fillet her to the south, but was the same appearance as the first two. this object passed in front of the moon, remaining very visible, which eliminated us thinking these were reflections of some kind. the intensity and direction of travel were the same as the previous two. i was able to focus in on this one better by blocking out ambient lighting with my hand, and was able to follow it across the sky for about 130+ degrees. as the object passed over head, though barely visible,, the speed suddenly increased to an extremely high rate toward the north west. another person also witnessed the same. 
the sky was clear with stars visible. 
all of us agreed that we just witnessed an event that was not normal, and was something that none of us has ever seen happen before. 
a friend located in mansfield oh stated to me that she saw something similar north of mansfield, approx 25 minutes later. it was first thought it was a low flying plane of some type, but the object actions disproved that pretty quickly. no flashing lights were seen, only the described pulsating.
content.summary: Red pulsating orb, appeared to launch. faded with rise, with increased speed

content.detailedDescription:
1. in my back yard
2. i was looking up to the west and then saw a bright light behind a tree after it passed the tree i could see it clearly, it was bright like a diamondand that when i saw the 2nd object smaller and gray in color no lights on it and it went under the 1st object and headed north, i didn't pay to much attention to it for it was going to be out of sight anyway and the othere object was bright and looked alot bigger.3
3. i had my flashlite and was pointed at it and hoped it would blink back or something, it didn't have any running lights or blinking lights.
4. the bright object just keep on a stright path to the south maybe over by hwy 5? the othere object was dark gray and went under the bright one and headed north, and i stop to keep watching the bright one.
5. hoping it would single back. i just keep flashing my light at it and would change it by blinking at it nothing seemed to work.
6. went out of sight.
content.summary: Out in back yard saw a bright star, then i relized there was not a star that bright in that direction, as it passed the trees i got a better look.

1. in my back yard
2. i was looking up to the west and then saw a bright light behind a tree after it passed the tree i could see it clearly, it was bright like a diamondand that when i saw the 2nd object smaller and gray in color no lights on it and it went under the 1st object and headed north, i didn't pay to much attention to it for it was going to be out of sight anyway and the othere object was bright and looked alot bigger.3
3. i had my flashlite and was pointed at it and hoped it would blink back or something, it didn't have any running lights or blinking lights.

5. hoping it would single back. i just keep flashing my light at it and would change it by blinking at it nothing seemed to work.
6. went out of sight.

1. in my back yard
2. i was looking up to the west and then saw a bright light behind a tree after it passed the tree i could see it clearly, it was bright like a diamondand that when i saw the 2nd object smaller and gray in color no lights on it and it went under the 1st object and headed north, i didn't pay to much attention to it for it was going to be out of sight anyway and the othere object was bright and looked alot bigger.3

content.detailedDescription: Friday night, august 23 at 8 pm i was outside smoking a cigar in la mirada, california.  there were many jets and planes in the night sky, like usual.  you can see the jets heading to the la airport to land coming from many directions.  at 8pm, a bright light went directly over me.  it came from the north and flew out of sight to the south.  there were no collision lights and no sound.  the light did seem to pulse, but very different than collision lights seen on the jets and planes.  but for the most part, this first event was a solid white light.  this event took about 4 minutes.  anyway, this light did not look like any of the dozens of planes seen while standing outside.  then there was a second sighting at 8:20 pm.  this bright light also traveled from the north to the south, but passed more to the east from me. this time, the light slowly turned off just after it passed me.  just turned off.  nothing.  this second event lasted about 2 minutes.
content.summary: Bright light with no collision lights directly overhead; then it disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: We were sitting in the backyard at a fire pit. i seen something in the corner of my eye. looked up and i saw the first object. i told everyone to look. it went straight then zig zag, went straight and it was getting faint as it proceeded straight. once that one disappeared another ne apart. the next one did zig zag but by as much. it moved faster than the first one. then it disappeared in the sam spot as the first one. first everyone thought it was a airplane but then it zig zag and the was only on light and it was bright red.We were all creeped out about it. i did take a video of the second one.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Red disk like that zig zagged went straight. geot faint as it moved then disappeared (2)

content.detailedDescription: Sitting on back deck, when a large, orange-colored object appeared in the east, traveling west.  no noise.  looked very similar to a chinese lantern at first, but traveled too fast and kept a constant, unwavering course.   very similar in appearance to 2-such objects observed in july.  however, those noted in july were bright red, rather than orange.
content.summary: Just a large glowing, silent light

content.detailedDescription:
Pretty much short description, i checked around for helicopters but heard nothing and didnt see any planes, idk let me know what you guys think. 
thanks
content.summary: Was smoking a nice joint, decided to snap a photo in the mountains, saw it after i took the photo

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside working in my yard in the evening hours of the day, as i finished my work i saw what i thought was jupiter in the late evening sky. i had plans to come out after a shower and look at jupiter through my binoculars. by the time i actually got outside on my deck on the back of my house i was unable to find jupiter and had assumed that it had dropped below the horizon. i like to look at the stars at night anyhow. it was about 8:50 pm (est.) after a few minutes of star gazing (at about 8:58pm) i saw a rather bright light in the night sky, from my view point facing west and per my cell phone compass and a hand based map compass, the object (a bright white light about the size of aspirin, came out of the west (about 240 degrees approx)traveling from the west/southwest in an south/south east direction (210 degrees approx). i looked for aircraft marker lights (the red or green and the flashing/pulsing white marker light) but did not see any. i first saw the object with my naked eye, and then used my binoculars to see if i could see the any marker lights that may have been out of my range of vision with out the binoculars. i was not or did not see any such standard aircraft marker lights with my binoculars. i had my wife come out and look, (she did not use the binoculars) but she saw the light/object. we watched it for about 45 seconds. it was hard to judge the distance or speed of the object as it seemed to be what i would approximate at an upper altitude, what i would guess some jet airliners travel when near or at their upper limit of altitude,(my best guess on this maybe 20 to 30 thousand feet). a couple of things that i noticed was that there was no sound, that one would normally hear with a jet even at an upper altitude. i was a military brat and am versed in the delay of the sound of the engine and the relative position of the aircraft, as heard from a ground based observation. the second was that i could not see or make out any marker lights( as described above), as the moon had not risen in to the sky at this time to provide any additional lighting, i could not tell if there was a vapor/'chemtrail' from this object. the night sky was clear with no major cloud cover or systems in the area at the time of the viewing, only a little ambient light from surrounding ground based locations (city street lights and such).
the object traveled in a direction that took it over my roof from my perspective and was about to cross out of my view when i ran inside to get my video camera and then proceeded to my front door, to follow object from the front of my house, (unfortunately, the battery in my cam corder was dead and the 30 seconds or so it took me to get it out of the bag, (after entering the house from the back deck and then proceeding to the front door) i emerged and looked for the object in the sky from the front of my house vantage point and it was gone. i do not think that it was a comet or satellite, as i have seen several of these and am a novice star watcher, i am aware of what a meteor/shooting star. this is my first report to date. i am not sure what i saw, but thought it might be useful if it was an actual ufo and other saw and reported it.
content.summary: Bright sing;e white light, no pulsing, no aircraft markinglights, traveled from west to east

content.detailedDescription: Me and my friend were sitting on the beach looking at the stars. we saw two shooting stars (5 minutes in between). a few minutes after the second shooting star, we saw a very fast, oval like, object that had an orange glow. we first noticed the object when we were looking at a blinking star to the north east. when we first noticed the object we thought it was commercial plane. we then realized that planes do not glow orange or move as fast as the object we saw. the object was moving in a straight path moving outward to sea. the object was also gaining elevation as it was moving forward. during the sighting of the object were we very confused and debating what it could be. the object then disappeared as if it was never there. after the sighting we were in shock and very excited about our experience.
content.summary: Very fast, oval like, orange glow, vanished

content.detailedDescription: Hey guy's ...I am baffleed. my backyard lawn has a discoloration , that is in the form of a circle.  the grass  appears to be burnt, yet if you reach down and pull the grass out, it has a sooty film on it,very compareable to charcoal ashes. yet the blade of grass is still green and hydrated beneath this sooty film. i googled ,,,lawn rings,grass circles, etc...Closest thing i found was something referred to as "lawn faires, which is a fungal infection in the grass which kills down to the root....Nothing matches. i estimate the diameter of the ring to be 10 ft in diameter.  enlighten me peoples ! could be nothing....But i can't find anything like it on the internet .?  p.S..Nice screening process....Just kidding,that sucked.
content.summary: Na

content.detailedDescription:
My daughter and i were traveling west on fletcher ave. headed to walmart. we glanced up at three lights that looked like just balls of fire and at first didnt pay it much attention thinking they were planes. as they crossed fletcher we realized they were only about 200 ft in the air and had no other lights, such as a green, red or other lights that would make them identifiable as a something we are familiar with. the lights also were more amber in color much like fire and not white. we lost sight of them in the trees so we stopped the car in at that moment we saw one but now it was going west. only a helicopter could make a move such as this and it went right over and did not make a sound. helicopters also have additional lights this thing had no other lights. 

other people had to see this thing as well. but we have searched the internet and no one has reported anything that we can have found so far. we did not think to record this either with our phones which we now regret.
content.summary: While traveling down fletcher ave we noticed three lights

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were walking our dogs when i noticed at least a dozen lights in the sky low to the ne. these lights were star like. red in color and pulsed. being a retired air traffic controller i am familiar with aircraft lights at night. these were all only red in color and pulsed at random, not like aircraft lights. the objects appeared to track sw gaining altitude and at about 30 degrees above the horizon they turned north and disappeared. we observed up to a dozen lights at a time in a staggered line and as the leading lights faded away new lights were appearing from behind the trees. the whole event lasted approx 90 sec and we saw at least 18 separate lights. due to my back ground i did not feel that these were aircraft, especially since there were so many in close proximity to each other, and how they just vanished like they went into a cloud, except it was a clear night with no clouds in the sky.
content.summary: Observed i dr a dozen red lights in a line that gained altitude, turned to the north and disappeared..

content.detailedDescription: This would be my 4th time seeing this in the sky in the past 5months. first time was back in the spring possibly april or may. i walk the dog for the night. one time i seen 4 glowing redish orange glowing orbs in the north east sky eventually blinking out one by one. since every other week or so i've seen them in the north west sky. coming from the horizon or from behind the trees then going up then eventually fading out. the first time i thought it might have been hot air balloons or something. but there has been no hot air baloon launches.  also i've seen these in two parts of the sky. freelky to say the least .
content.summary: Red orang fireball that eventually disappeared

content.detailedDescription: Bright orange light...Thought it was a lantern and then realized it was not. moved fairly quick very strange
content.summary: Not a lantern....Moved in a straight line faster than a lantern
